headline: Does Alpha Modus' Patent Lawsuit Challenge a Core Advantage for Johnson Controls (JCI) in Smart Infrastructure?
summary: In October 2025, Alpha Modus Corp. filed patent infringement lawsuits in the U.S. against Johnson Controls International and several other technology firms, alleging unauthorized use of its AI-based retail analytics and engagement technologies. These lawsuits underscore escalating legal disputes over the foundational intellectual property that underpins much of the in-store analytics and digital engagement solutions now used worldwide in retail. Industry analysts have recently highlighted...

headline: HVAC Air Filters Market Outlook Report 2025-2035: Rising Air Quality Awareness, HVAC Installations, and Adoption of Smart and Antimicrobial Filtration Technologies Bolster Growth
summary: The global HVAC air filters market is predicted to reach $14.08 billion by 2035, growing at a CAGR of 5.1% from 2025. Driven by rising indoor air quality awareness, this market benefits from increased construction, HVAC installations, and e-commerce growth. Key players include 3M, Camfil AB, and Johnson Controls. The HEPA filters segment is set for the highest growth due to demand for high-efficiency air quality solutions. Meanwhile, the MERV 5-8 segment leads due to cost-performance balance. As

headline: Johnson Controls price target raised to $116 from $114 at RBC Capital
summary: RBC Capital raised the firm’s price target on Johnson Controls (JCI) to $116 from $114 and keeps a Sector Perform rating on the shares as part of a broader research note previewing Q3 earnings in Industrials space. Multiple multi-year sector drivers – like electrification, reshoring, and datacenter/AI – and a Fed ease cycle should fuel continued mid-cycle growth and strong earnings visibility, while tariffs remain a fluid but manageable headwind for now, the analyst tells investors in a research
